definition: to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]

sentences.english: At the beginning of sixty time cut a striking figure painting, after study at the Xi'an Academy of Fine Arts.
sentences.chinese: 六十年代初在画坛崭露头角，后深造于西安美术学院。

sentences.english: But the influence of Italian masters blew at gale force across 17th-century Dutch painting.
sentences.chinese: 但是意大利的大师们对17世纪荷兰画坛影响巨大。

sentences.english: The western painter's self-portrait establishes a new school in the world art painting world.
sentences.chinese: 西方画家的自画像在世界艺术画坛中独树一帜。

sentences.english: Yang Yan, famous modern Chinese master of painting, enjoys considerable influence in painting scene.
sentences.chinese: 中国当代著名绘画大师，在中国画坛享有广泛的影响。

definition: freehand drawing or painting in traditional Chinese style
blue-and-green landscape (genre of landscape painting originating in the Tang dynasty, in which blues and greens predominate)
Xu Beihong (1895-1953), famous European trained painter and influential art teacher
Shi Tao (1642-1707), Chinese landscape painter and poet
Huang Binhong (1865-1955), art historian and literati painter
Chang Dai-chien or Zhang Daqian (1899-1983), one of the greatest Chinese artists of the 20th century
